result.adr_address: Shop A (Portion), G/F., Sai On House, No. 93-95 Belcher's Street, Hong Kong, Kennedy Town, Hong Kong
result.formatted_address: Shop A (Portion), G/F., Sai On House, No. 93-95 Belcher's Street, Hong Kong, Kennedy Town, Hong Kong
result.name: Blueplace Cafe

reviews.text:
Coffee was good but being asked to leave wasn’t. 

I visited with an elderly relative who wasn’t feeling too good but needed a place to rest and I ordered a coffee.
Beware there is an unwritten rule that every person that enters must make a purchase. This wouldn’t have been a problem if I hadn’t already made a purchase but I had. When the drink was brought to the table my relative was asked to make a purchase. 

When I asked to see the sign or why it wasn’t written in the menu I was told it was “..only a spoken rule.” 
I’d ordered a coffee and was told if I don’t order something for the person I was with that the “cameras upstairs will see that you didn’t order anything”. There was another couple in the cafe at the time who only ordered one drink, but somehow they were okay to do so! If it was obvious from the beginning that everyone needs to order 1 thing I wouldn’t have even set foot in the cafe. 

I asked to speak to the manager who arrived over an hour later, and treated me with suspicion from the get go. I tried to explain but he wasn’t listening and became angry and loud. So much so that I asked to talk downstairs away from other customers. (To save his face not mine). The barista had perhaps told him that I had refused to order and so the manager didn’t even believe that I had ordered a anything. The coffee cup was still at the table, in plain sight. 

When suggesting that there should be a sign mentioning the fact that everyone needs to order something I was shouted down and told to “cut the crap” by the manager. No problem to order something if the staff were reasonable and courteous, but being shouted at in front of the whole cafe and being told to leave because of their unfair business practice is simply astonishing. Abysmal experience. 

At least the barista said sorry as we were leaving!

Much more I could say but...

If you’re thinking about trying a cafe that isn’t a large chain in this area, you’re better off going elsewhere.

Cozy, relaxing, and almost empty on a Monday afternoon. Nice service, and the cake and tea were good.
A nice cafe to avoid the big chains in the area.

Strongly recommend!!
Great food and excellent service
Super friendly staff(chef?)
seldom drink coffee but this coffee really deserve a try! 
will be back definitely;)
Don't let the downstairs fool you; surprisingly large and comfortable upstairs.  Had salmon risotto (pretty good) and a coffee (well made)
A fantastic, calm place to hang out. Coffee and purple potato latte were great, just wish they'd been a bit hotter.
